title: A Strange Land
opening: Having narrowly escaped Daein's grasp the Greil Mercenaries are pleased to feel the ocean beneath their feet as they set sail. According to Captain Nasir, the voyage to Begnion will take roughly two months.
Blessed with temperate weather the ship's journey southward is smooth and steady. As it passes the midpoint of its trip, the  ship sets a course along the coastline and begins to head east.
These seas belong to Phoenicis and Kilvas, the kingdoms of the bird tribes.Both nations prey on human vessels for supplies and wealth, and their flying corsairs are feared across the seas.
Additionally, the southern portion of the continent contains the realm of the dragon tribe: the monarchy of Goldoa.
This country remained isolated founding centuries past, preserving its] closed culture behind a veil of mystery.
It is these laguz-controlled waters that Ike and company must now cross.

intro.speaker: Mist
intro.line: Ike?

intro.speaker: Mist
intro.line: What's bothering you? You've been moping around ever since we came aboard.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: I'm...just a little seasick.

intro.speaker: Mist
intro.line: Seasick? You're such a bad liar. You never even get regular sick. You're not the type to get seasick!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Really, it's nothing.

intro.speaker: Mist
intro.line: Come on, talk to me. You've been doing so much lately. I just want the chance to help you for a change.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Well...All right. I'll tell you what's been bothering me. It's that incident back in Toha.

intro.speaker: Mist
intro.line: Go on.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: When everyone discovered Ranulf was a laguz, all those people--they changed, just like that. Up until that instant, they'd seemed like such kind and decent people. I just...I had no idea beorc prejudice against the laguz was so strong. Why do they hate them so much? How are we so different, Ranulf and I?

intro.speaker: Mist
intro.line: I have to say, at first, I was scared, too. When I saw how they could change...They can do things that we hu--I mean, we beorc can't do. They're not like us...

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Mist, you can't honestly feel...

intro.speaker: Mist
intro.line: It's different now! Everyone's so very nice. But, you know, that's because of all the time we've spent together. I've seen how they are; I've gotten to know them. That's why I've changed. I'm not scared or nervous around them, but other people don't get that chance. I think that's why they're frightened.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Maybe you're right...Maybe people like me are the odd ones, the people who accept others as they are.

intro.speaker: Mist
intro.line: I wish more people were like that. I mean, no one really wants to fight, do they? Doesn't everyone WANT peace? I guess it's just hard to put all of those fears behind us.

intro.speaker: Unknown
intro.line: You're right. It is very hard.

intro.speaker: Mist
intro.line: Nasir! What's the big idea, eavesdropping on us like that?

intro.speaker: Nasir
intro.line: How do you find sailing? Have you gotten sick at all?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: We're fine. But answer a question for me, would you? Why are you here? Why do you associate with the laguz?

intro.speaker: Nasir
intro.line: Why? Besides the obvious financial benefits, I suppose I do so because I am one.

intro.speaker: Mist
intro.line: What? No, you're not a laguz! I don't see any tail or anything!

intro.speaker: Nasir
intro.line: Because I've chosen to live among beorc, I've taken certain steps to make sure I'm not recognized. I've had to change my attire, my feeding habits...I've done many things.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Why would you do that?

intro.speaker: Nasir
intro.line: Laguz cannot survive in isolation, nor can beorc. If both races are to thrive, they must learn to coexist. I have spent many years searching for a way to make this happen.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: You think that laguz and beorc can live together? After everything you must have seen? I'm impressed.

intro.speaker: Nasir
intro.line: Ike, you will never truly understand a matter unless you look at it from each party's perspective. As you say, the laguz are indeed now persecuted by the beorc. But long ago, these roles were reversed.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: ...Whatever happened in the past does not justify what we do to the laguz now.

intro.speaker: Nasir
intro.line: That is the thinking of an honest man. Keep things simple and pure. I like that. Still, the strength of your conviction comes from your youth and your innocence. Trust me: it will be tested. When your journey is over, how will you be changed? I pray your conviction is not lost to despair.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Talking to you is hard work.

intro.speaker: Nasir
intro.line: Someday, you'll understand. For now, my role is simply to deliver you safely to Begnion. Ranulf has paid me quite handsomely with money from the king of Gallia himself,and I will not let him down.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: We're out of our element here at sea, so you're all we have to depend on. Thank you for your help.

intro.speaker: Nasir
intro.line: I will do what I am able.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Nasir, what is it?

intro.speaker: Nasir
intro.line: Nothing. Nothing we can do anything about, at any rate. We're being followed by pirates.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Really? I don't see any ships...

intro.speaker: Nasir
intro.line: Not by sea. By air. Look up.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Are those...birds? If they are, they must be huge...

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Those are laguz, Ike.

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: Ravens from Kilvas. Their black wings are an ill omen for all who see them.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Titania, Soren, you noticed them coming as well?

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Yes, Soren and I saw them when we were discussing our plans from the aft decks.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: I'd heard stories, but...they're really flying. Wow.

intro.speaker: Nasir
intro.line: We're still out of their range, but airborne foes can be especially troublesome. I'd prefer to avoid them altogether. Let's see if we can outrun them.

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: From what I've been told, the flying corsairs of Kilvas and Phoenicis are far more cruel than any beast laguz.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Winged pirates...How am I supposed to fight against that? Wha-what was that?

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Oof...It felt like we hit something.

intro.speaker: Nasir
intro.line: Blast...We've run aground! We must be caught on a reef or something! Move it, lads!Get the ship free!

intro.speaker: Seeker
intro.line: Predictable humans. Sailed right into our trap without fail.

intro.speaker: Raven Laguz
intro.line: Let's finish this quickly! It won't be long before Phoenicis or Goldoa takes an interest in what's happening here!

intro.speaker: Nasir
intro.line: Ike, the crows are coming!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Pull everyone together! Looks like we're in for a fight!

battle.speaker: Ike
battle.line: Soren! Do you have a plan?

battle.speaker: Soren
battle.line: I've done research in the past. All members of the bird tribes are vulnerable to wind magic. I think it's safe to assume that they are also as susceptible to arrows as any other flyer.

battle.speaker: Ike
battle.line: Wind magic and bows...All right! Everyone gather your weapons and prepare to meetthe enemy on the deck! I want a small group to remain belowdecks to protect Princess Elincia and the crew. We've never faced an enemy like this. I want everyone to stay together. Let's go!

battle.speaker: Jill
battle.line: Caught up...at last. I'll do this on my own. I will not let them escape! Huh? What are those things? Giant birds? Disgusting! Could they be...Are they...bird half-breeds?

recruit-talk.speaker: Jill
recruit-talk.line: You! Why are you lollygagging about?

recruit-talk.speaker: Jill
recruit-talk.line: I am Jill Fizzart, wyvern rider of Daein, attached to Commander Haar's battalion. I offer a truce! I cannot sit by  and allow a human vessel to be attacked by sub-human degenerates! I will fight with you!

recruit-talk.speaker: Ike
recruit-talk.line: We will accept no help from Daein!

recruit-talk.speaker: Jill
recruit-talk.line: This is no place for foolish pride! At this rate, the sub-humans will[ devour you--

recruit-talk.speaker: Ike
recruit-talk.line: I will not accept aid from anyone who thinks laguz are sub-human.

recruit-talk.speaker: Jill
recruit-talk.line: What are you babbling about? I'm on your side! We'll talk after I chase off these crows! Bleed the half-breed!

recruit-talk.speaker: Ike
recruit-talk.line: Hold it! What...What in the world is going on?

boss.speaker: Seeker
boss.line: Plunder away! King Naesala has given us his blessings!

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Is everyone all right?

end.speaker: Soren
end.line: I'll check on injuries.

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: Those crows make fierce opponents.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Nasir, how's the ship?

end.speaker: Nasir
end.line: Completely immobilized. We can't shake free of this reef.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: I feel useless just waiting around here. There has to be something I can do to help.

end.speaker: Mist
end.line: Hey! Ike! Where are you going? Should you be leaving the ship!?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Nothing's getting done sitting around here. I just want to go ashore and see what I can see.

end.speaker: Nasir
end.line: What? Hold on, Ike! You can't...That's--

end.speaker: Mist
end.line: Ah! Ike! Behind you!

end.speaker: Red Dragon Laguz
end.line: You there! What are you doing?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Huh?

end.speaker: Nasir
end.line: This could be trouble...

end.speaker: Red Dragon Laguz
end.line: This is Goldoan territory. Outsiders are not permitted.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: No, wait, you don't understand! Our ship has run aground. There's nothing we can do! We're stuck here!

end.speaker: Red Dragon
end.line: Then return to your ship. What happens to beorc is none of our affair.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: That's ridiculous! You're a complete--

end.speaker: Red Dragon Laguz
end.line: You have been warned. You will not be warned a second time. Hey!

end.speaker: Kurthnaga
end.line: Cease this at once! What do you think you're doing?

end.speaker: Red Dragon Laguz
end.line: My...My lord prince.

end.speaker: Kurthnaga
end.line: Man of the beorc. My countrymen were discourteous. I ask that you forgive them.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Who are you? I am Kurthnaga, prince of Goldoa.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: The prince? Now we're getting somewhere. Thanks to some Kilvas pirates, our ship's run aground. Can you lend us any help?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: What is it? You can't help us, can you?

end.speaker: Kurthnaga
end.line: I am not used to being addressed in such a direct manner. I was...taken off guard. My apologies.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: No, I didn't--If anyone should apologize here, it's me. My father had a great deal to say about my lack of etiquette. I'm sorry. I didn't mean to offend you.

end.speaker: Kurthnaga
end.line: Please, pay it no mind. I am more concerned with the misfortune your journey has met.Of late, the ravens have grown ever more barbarous, and this cannot stand. My father will lodge a formal protest with Kilvas, I assure you. In the meantime, we shall help you with your ship. Gareth, direct the others to push their ship free.

end.speaker: Gareth
end.line: At once!

end.speaker: Mist
end.line: Dragons! They're all dragons! They're huge! And so strong! It's incredible!

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: It's overwhelming...

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Yeah...it is.

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: Goldoa is the land of the dragons. More than any other laguz tribe, they are known for their longevity. I've heard tales of Goldoans still living who flew the skies when the goddess herself still walked the land.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: How is it you know so much about Goldoa?

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: Everything I've learned comes from books. Goldoa itself no longer has any contact with the outside world. Seeing them now, it's like a dream...

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: So this is good fortune, is that what you're saying?

end.speaker: Mist
end.line: She's saying we got lucky! For once, your recklessness actually got us] OUT of trouble!

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: What's that supposed to mean?

end.speaker: Kurthnaga
end.line: We have moved your ship safely and without harm to you or your vessel.

end.speaker: Kurthnaga
end.line: My subjects tell me your ship was indeed lodged against a reef. However, there was no structural damage to your ship. You need not interrupt your journey.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: That's good news. Thank you.

end.speaker: Kurthnaga
end.line: Is there anything else you require? If you need food or fresh water, we can replenish your supplies.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: That would be most appreciated. We are beginning to run low on water. As for food, anyfruit, meat, fish...anything fresh would be wonderful

end.speaker: Kurthnaga
end.line: It shall be done. Gareth, will you see to it?

end.speaker: Gareth
end.line: Yes, at once.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: I know that Goldoa does not engage in trade with other nations, but will you accept gold in payment?

end.speaker: Kurthnaga
end.line: Do not worry about payment.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: But you've done so much for us when you could have left us to die out there. We must repay you somehow.

end.speaker: Kurthnaga
end.line: Sweet courtesy is ever the herald of hospitality. Will this suffice to explain my actions?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Hospitality? Isn't that for guests?

end.speaker: Kurthnaga
end.line: As you know, Goldoa prefers isolation. We rarely see foreigners, especially beorc, and even more rarely do we treat with them. Chance has brought us together, and I am grateful for this opportunity. In fact, I wish we could feast a while and converse. However, my father would never allow it.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: You can't expect us to accept so generous a gift--

end.speaker: Kurthnaga
end.line: But I do. I insist that you consider it a personal gift from Goldoa's prince. However, I have made you uncomfortable, so if you feel you must decline...

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: No, of course not. We will be happy to accept your gift. We appreciate it.

end.speaker: Kurthnaga
end.line: I'm so pleased you understand.

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: Ike! Captain Nasir wants to depart as soon as possible.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Understood.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Well then, I beg your leave. Prince Kurthnaga, I won't forget your kindness. Thank you!

end.speaker: Kurthnaga
end.line: It was my pleasure. Take care.

end.speaker: Kurthnaga
end.line: Farewell, beorc! May your journey be safe!

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: My lord Ike, is something amiss?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: First, those ravens attack us, and then a band of Goldoan dragons rescues us. I can't understand how they are all considered laguz. Is that strange?

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: No, I see what you're saying...Just as there are both good and evil beorc, there must be good and evil laguz as well. But they are so distinct in appearance...It is tempting to assume each race is, as a whole, intrinsically good or evil.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Aye, that it is. The beast tribes of Gallia and the dragons of Goldoa seem sohonorable...and the birds of Kilvas and Phoenicis seem so cruel. It seems so easy to reduce them all to good or evil.

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: I'm sure it can't be as simple as that...

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Look at us beorc: Daeins are evil, and Crimeans are not. It's as simple as that.Well, wait...There were those prejudiced fools we met in port. They weren't all that honorable. Maybe you're right.

end.speaker: Nasir
end.line: Much of what seems good and evil is simply a matter of perspective, Ike. Many conditions affect our judgment. Drawing a definitive line is nigh impossible.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Nasir! Where have you been? You vanished without a trace.

end.speaker: Nasir
end.line: I am uncomfortable around dragons. I thought it would be better if I stayed below in my cabin. My apologies.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Now that you mention it, Soren seems to have disappeared as well. Have you seen him?

end.speaker: Nasir
end.line: Perhaps he's feeling nauseated. For one unaccustomed to sea travel, it's not uncommon.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Right...I think I'll check up on him later.

end.speaker: Nasir
end.line: The wind is picking up. I believe I will go and check on the condition of our sails. Keep yourselves warm up here. It's a chill wind that blows in these waters.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Princess Elincia, you should be returning to your cabin.

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: What about you, my lord Ike?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: I'll stay on deck a while longer. I have a lot to think about.

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: Would you mind if I stayed here with you? I won't be any bother.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Hm? It's all right with me...

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: Oh, thank you.

conversation.speaker: Unknown
conversation.line: Ah, Ike! Grab that boy!

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: What's going on?

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: Mm!

conversation.speaker: Nasir
conversation.line: No more running for you.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Nasir, who is this?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: A stowaway. I gather he boarded the ship at Toha.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: What are you doing here? Why did you sneak aboard the ship?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: You won't talk? In that case...

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: Hm? Ow...oouuuch!

conversation.speaker: Nasir
conversation.line: Ike, there's no need to be so rough!

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: I'm not going to waste my time playing games with this urchin. You want me to let you go? Open your mouth and start talking.

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: Owowow! Quit it! I'll talk!!

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: ...That hurt! I thought you were gonna break my face...

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Well? What's your name? What are you doing here?

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: I'm...Sothe. I'm...I'm a thief, but...I didn't come onboard this ship to steal anything.

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: Stop scowling at me like that! You're making me uncomfortable.

conversation.speaker: Nasir
conversation.line: It's not just you. Ike always looks like that. Don't mind him; just keep talking.

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: I'm...looking for someone. I heard this ship was sailing for Begnion, so I decided to climb aboard.

conversation.speaker: Nasir
conversation.line: This person you're after is in Begnion?

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: I don't know. The trail went cold in Toha, and...I couldn't think of anywhere else to go from there.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Is it family?

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: Huh?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: The person you're looking for.

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: Yeah. I mean, we're not related by blood or anything, but...we're definitely family.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Nasir, my mercenary company will look after this boy. He won't be a burden to you or your crew.

conversation.speaker: Nasir
conversation.line: If that's what you want to do, it's fine with me.

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: Are you sure?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: You're going to be put to work. I hope you're prepared.

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: Sure, no problem! I'll..I'll do whatever you need!

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: I wish we could help you, but we have our own troubles to deal with.

conversation.speaker: Nasir
conversation.line: I see your point...This is a very difficult time for all of you.

conversation.speaker: Nasir
conversation.line: I see no other option. I'll take you on as a junior member of my crew.

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: Really?

conversation.speaker: Nasir
conversation.line: It's either that or I toss you overboard, and I suspect you'd prefer I didn't.

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: Thank you! I'll repay you somehow! I swear it!

conversation.speaker: Nasir
conversation.line: Don't worry about the boy, Ike. We'll take care of him.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: It's your ship. You can do as you please.

conversation.speaker: Nasir
conversation.line: Well then, it's settled. Sothe, was it? Come, and I'll introduce you to the rest of my crew.

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: Sure!

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: You're a lucky boy.

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: I'm just happy I don't have to hide anymore!

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: ...Volke?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Right here.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Gah! Where've you been? You disappeared the moment we got on this ship!

conversation.speaker: Volke
conversation.line: Don't worry about it. I'll be there when you need me.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: It's not me; it's my sister. You've never once shown up for a meal, and she thinks you're dying of hunger.

conversation.speaker: Volke
conversation.line: Did we ever eat together while we were on land?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: All right, listen. Land? Big. Ship? Small. It's not the same thing! I don't want Mist roaming the ship with a plate of food anymore. So please, eat one meal a day with us.

conversation.speaker: Volke
conversation.line: One hundred gold.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: You're going to charge me? To make you eat? And that's more than you charge to pick a lock! Why?

conversation.speaker: Volke
conversation.line: I don't like large groups. Bye. Call me if you decide it's worth it.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Maybe I should just tell Mist he's dead...

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Do you have a minute?

conversation.speaker: Zihark
conversation.line: Of course, Commander Ike.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: You and I haven't had very many opportunities to talk, and I--

conversation.speaker: Zihark
conversation.line: You don't think you can trust me?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: No, it's not that. I'm just curious--I was surprised to see anyone in Toha who chose to fight on the side of the laguz.

conversation.speaker: Zihark
conversation.line: I joined the Toha vigilantes solely for the purpose of saving laguz. I'm not from Crimea, but when I heard she had joined with Gallia, I envisioned my perfect world, one in which the laguz could live normal lives, free of oppression. However, when I came to Crimea, I found things were no different there than in any other beorc nation.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: It was the same for me. I couldn't allow myself to ignore these problems any longer.

conversation.speaker: Zihark
conversation.line: I'm happy to hear it. Of all the beorc I've ever met, you're the only one who shares my conviction.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Zihark, is there...some other reason you defend the laguz?

conversation.speaker: Zihark
conversation.line: I don't follow you.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: You see, I was born in Gallia, or so I've been told. I just wondered if you had a similar reason guiding you.

conversation.speaker: Zihark
conversation.line: ...Of course I have my reasons. Would you be upset if I didn't want to discuss them? My reasons are...extremely personal.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: No, it's no problem. I wanted a better understanding of what kind of man you are, and I have that now.

conversation.speaker: Zihark
conversation.line: Can I ask what that is?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: You are a good man. I'm glad to have you along.

conversation.speaker: Zihark
conversation.line: I'm glad to be here. I feel I'm finally able to do the kind of good I've longed to do for years.

conversation.speaker: Ilyana
conversation.line: Ooo...

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: You don't look so well. Are you all right?

conversation.speaker: Ilyana
conversation.line: I'm...seasick...When I was traveling with the merchants, we sometimes used...ships...Every time was the same... Urp...I'm...sorry.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Did you travel with Muston and the others for a long time?

conversation.speaker: Ilyana
conversation.line: About four years, all told. I had just left home, you see...I was all alone, and I couldn't find work. In my hometown, I had so many people I could depend on...but once I left, everything changed. If Muston's group hadn't found me by the side of the road, I'd probably be dead by now.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Hm...You seem to have led quite an adventurous life. It's a bit surprising.

conversation.speaker: Ilyana
conversation.line: I get that a lot.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: I find it hard to imagine that you couldn't find work, though. Your magic skills are amazing.

conversation.speaker: Ilyana
conversation.line: Aren't they, though? Hee hee! I'm always happy when people notice...Whew...Wow! I feel so much better now. I'm actually starting to get hungry.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: I'm glad to hear it. Just stay above deck, and when you start to feel sick, look off at the horizon, all right?
